intro: Bassovia gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's bassovia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires partial to full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bassovia gardneri is considered a conservation concern.
